5) syncing the music to the film: the filmmaker needs to select the parts of the music that best fit the mood and tone of the specific scene. this is often achieved by cutting the track and syncing it to the individual scene's pace.

in conclusion, selecting appropriate music for a jazz documentary is a critical process that requires careful consideration of the project's objectives, research, and legal requirements. it is possible that gonzo has a similar process in place to ensure that they select the best tracks to enhance the footage and convey the documentary's message effectively.
